CONJUGATES: bosses (n pl) | bosses (v 3rd sg) | bossing (v pres p) | bossed (v past t/p)
ETYMOLOGY: From Dutch baas 'master, foreman', which was adopted into English, particularly in North America, in the mid-17th century.

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A person responsible for supervising or directing workers or an organization; a manager or superior.
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: My boss approved my request for annual leave.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 我的老板批准了我的年假申请。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: Transitive verb followed by an adverbial phrase
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: To constantly give orders to people, often in a domineering, irritating, or unnecessary manner.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 发号施令；对...指手画脚 (常带有贬义)
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: Stop bossing me around; I know how to do my job!
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 别再对我指手画脚了，我知道该怎么做我的工作！

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: An influential local political leader or party organizer who controls the votes or operations of a particular area.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: （美国地方政治组织的）头目，党魁
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The city boss ensured loyalty among his followers through patronage.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 这位城市党魁通过施惠确保了追随者的忠诚。
